chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Maschil of Ethan the Ezrahite.
items.plainText: Maschil of Ethan the Ezrahite.

items.text: I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.
items.plainText: I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.

items.text: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.
items.plainText: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.

items.text: I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David my servant,
items.plainText: I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David my servant,

items.text: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.
items.plainText: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.

items.text: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.
items.plainText: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.

items.text: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the LORD?
items.plainText: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the LORD?

items.text: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all them that are about him.
items.plainText: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all them that are about him.

items.text: O LORD God of hosts, who is a strong LORD like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?
items.plainText: O LORD God of hosts, who is a strong LORD like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?

items.text: Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.
items.plainText: Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.

items.text: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.
items.plainText: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.

items.text: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.
items.plainText: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.

items.text: The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.
items.plainText: The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.

items.text: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
items.plainText: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.

items.text: Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.
items.plainText: Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.

items.text: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O LORD, in the light of thy countenance.
items.plainText: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O LORD, in the light of thy countenance.

items.text: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
items.plainText: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.

items.text: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.
items.plainText: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.

items.text: For the LORD is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.
items.plainText: For the LORD is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.

items.text: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
items.plainText: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

items.text: I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:
items.plainText: I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:

items.text: With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.
items.plainText: With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.

items.text: The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
items.plainText: The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

items.text: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.
items.plainText: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.

items.text: But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.
items.plainText: But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

items.text: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.
items.plainText: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.

items.text: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
items.plainText: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.

items.text: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.
items.plainText: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.

items.text: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.
items.plainText: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

items.text: His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.
items.plainText: His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

items.text: If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;
items.plainText: If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;

items.text: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;
items.plainText: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;

items.text: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.
items.plainText: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.

items.text: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.
items.plainText: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.

items.text: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.
items.plainText: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.

items.text: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.
items.plainText: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.

items.text: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.
items.plainText: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.

items.text: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.
items.plainText: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.

items.text: But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.
items.plainText: But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.

items.text: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.
items.plainText: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.

items.text: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.
items.plainText: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.

items.text: All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.
items.plainText: All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.

items.text: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
items.plainText: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.

items.text: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.
items.plainText: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.

items.text: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.
items.plainText: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.

items.text: The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.
items.plainText: The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.

items.text: How long, LORD? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?
items.plainText: How long, LORD? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?

items.text: Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?
items.plainText: Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?

items.text: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.
items.plainText: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.

items.text: Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?
items.plainText: Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?

items.text: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;
items.plainText: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;

items.text: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O LORD; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.
items.plainText: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O LORD; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.

items.text: Blessed be the LORD for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
items.plainText: Blessed be the LORD for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
